page.title: 11EDUCATION PRIMARY BREDGAR
page.content: The Church of England School was built in 1868.There are two full-time staff and one part-time secretary.Pupils are taken from the village, their ages ranging from five to eleven.They then have to make the three mile journey to secondary schools in Sittingbourne.The school is very much a part of village life and all the people are very supportive; the parent teachers association does most of the fund raising.The number of pupils has decreased over the years, from 74 ten years ago to 36.The school still has a Second World War air raid shelter in the grounds which is used for storing cleaning and sports equipment.The school buildings include a teacher's house and recent modifications have included lower ceilings, the old being thirty feet high.
